div.l: Here is ended the Millers tale
And here beginneth the Prolog of the Reue

div.l: Of Absolon and hende Nicholas
Diuerse folk diuersly they seide
But for the more part they louȝ and pleide
Ne at his tale I saw noman̄ him greue
But it were only Osewold the Reue
Be cause he was of Carpenteres craft
A litil Ire is in his herte lafte
He gan to grucche and blame it a lite
So theik qduod he ful wel couthe I the quite
With blering of a proude Mellers ye
If that me list to speke of ribaudie
But ik am olde me list nat pley for age
Gras tyme is don̄ my foder is forage
This white top writeth myn olde yeres
Myn hete is also mouled as myn heres
But if I fare as doth an open̄ ars
That ilke frute is euer the lenger the wers
Til it be roten in mullok or in stree
We olde men̄ I drede so fare we
Til we ben roten̄ can we nat be ripe
We hoppen̄ alwey whil the world wil pipe
For in oure will ther stiketh euer a naill
To haue an hoor heer and a grene taill
As hath a leke for thouȝ oure miȝt begon̄
Oure will desireth foly euer in oon̄
For whan̄ we may nouȝt do than̄ wol ye speke
Yet in oure asshen̄ olde fire is I reke
Foure gledes han we which I shal deuise
Auᵃaunting lyeng angre Couetise
